issue.title: [CF 956] TMW Failing to initialize, but only on one of several characters
issue.body:
IMPORTANT: If your issue is only occurring with a specific icon, include an export string of the icon in this ticket. Subsequently, if the issue involves an entire group or an entire profile, include the entire export string of the group or profile.

To get an export string, open the icon editor, and click button labeled "Import/Export/Backup". Select the "To string" option for the appropriate export type (icon, group, or profile), and then press CTRL+C to copy it to your clipboard.

FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE ABOVE INSTRUCTIONS WILL RESULT IN YOUR TICKET BEING INVALIDATED.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Logging into my priest but so far not other toons even on different servers, only seems to be effecting 1 of 6
2.
3.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
After the update today to 7.0 everything seems fine on other characters, but when loging into my priest, tmw will not load, i do have the new tmw icon onscreen, when i type /tmw is get the error "tmw cant preform caction bc it failed to initialize

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
7.0.0

Do you have an error log of what happened?
Message: ...en\Components\IconModules\IconModule_Texts\Texts.lua:150: attempt to concatenate field 'Name' (a nil value)
Time: 06/20/14 15:55:44
Count: 1
Stack: ...en\Components\IconModules\IconModule_Texts\Texts.lua:150: in function `?'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:2863: in function `DoUpgrade'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:3002: in function `UpgradeProfile'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1845: in function `InitializeDatabase'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1774: in function `Initialize'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:3121: in function `UpdateNormally'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:3304: in function `Update'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1877: in function `?'
...When\Lib\CallbackHandler-1.0\CallbackHandler-1.0.lua:147: in function <...When\Lib\CallbackHandler-1.0\CallbackHandler-1.0.lua:147>
[string "safecall Dispatcher[1]"]:4: in function <[string "safecall Dispatcher[1]"]:4>
[C]: ?
[string "safecall Dispatcher[1]"]:13: in function `?'
...When\Lib\CallbackHandler-1.0\CallbackHandler-1.0.lua:92: in function `Fire'
...\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Lib\AceEvent-3.0\AceEvent-3.0.lua:120: in function <...\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Lib\AceEvent-3.0\AceEvent-3.0.lua:119>

Locals: <none>

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)


> Posted by CurseForge user sagan99 | Imported from CurseForge issue #956 | Raw

comments.body:
Thanks for the report. Someone else reported this earlier, but they gave an incomplete error message so I was unable to determine what the cause was.

This should be fixed in gb45506f. (Download it from the Files tab at the top of this page once it packages - that might take an hour or more because the packager seems to be quite broken at the moment.). Let me know if that does not fix the issue - post any new errors that you get.

Edited Jun 20, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Its packaged now.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

That did the trick, Thanks :)


> Posted by CurseForge user sagan99
